item.title: iPhone 16, Apple Intelligence, AirPods 4 and more: Everything revealed at Apple Event 2024

item.description:
Apple's lineup of announcements echoed many of the anticipated hardware reveals, including the new iPhone 16, AirPods 4, the Apple Watch Series 10 and more.

item.title: French embedded insurance startup Neat secures $55 million
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Neat helps other companies sell insurance products to their own customers. In insurance lingo, it focuses on affinity insurance contracts linked to another service or product.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: EV warranty startup Amber launches a remote diagnostic service for Teslas
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
EV warranty startup Amber is expanding nationwide, bringing on new vehicles and offering a new remote diagnostic scan — all signs that the one-year-old company is putting its recent $3.18 million seed round to good use. The startup launched an aftermarket warranty product for Tesla vehicles called AmberCare — which is a suite of warranty […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Everything announced at Apple’s Glowtime event
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Yesterday was Apple’s Glowtime event, and you know what that means – lots of new hardware for us to geek out on. As we anticipated based on the WWDC event in June, Apple is embedding a lot of new AI features into its devices. From the iPhone 16, to the AirPods 4 and AirPods Pro […]

item.title: SpaceX launches Polaris Dawn, where astronauts will venture further than any humans in more than 50 years
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
A SpaceX Falcon 9 lifted off in the early hours of Tuesday morning carrying a crew that will attempt the first commercial spacewalk and travel higher than any crewed mission in fifty years.  The Polaris Dawn mission lifted off from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center at 5:23 AM EST after several delays due to inclement weather. […]

item.title: Amazon trials last-mile deliveries by tram in Frankfurt
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Amazon has announced a new pilot package delivery service in Frankfurt, Germany, that meshes electric road and rail transport. The e-commerce giant will use vans from its delivery depot to the first tram stop on the outskirts of Frankfurt, with the city’s new Gütertram service transporting the goods to awaiting cargo bikes. Gütertram constitutes part […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple partners with third parties, like Google, on iPhone 16’s visual search
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Apple’s relationship with Google as its search partner is taking a new turn with Apple’s introduction of visual search, or “Visual Intelligence,” as the iPhone maker dubbed it Monday during the company’s “Glowtime” event. Already, Apple pays Alphabet roughly $20 billion per year to make Google the default search engine in its Safari browser. Now, […]

item.title: Creator startup Spotter raises another $7.4M
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Spotter, a startup that underwrites creators and offers AI tools, raised $7.4 million, according to a Form D filing viewed by TechCrunch. A representative for Spotter confirmed the filing’s legitimacy, but did not offer further details. This additional funding is much smaller than Spotter’s most recent raise, a $200 million Series D round led by […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Spare fixes cities’ outdated transport services for disabled residents
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Cities spend hundreds of millions each year on paratransit services, or public rides for disabled residents, yet those services remain limited and unpredictable. Wheelchair users often face late pickups, hindering them from getting to work or medical appointments on time. As populations age, the strain on these services and city budgets continues to grow.  Vancouver-based […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Lucid Motors’ Gravity SUV will have Tesla charging built in
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Lucid Motors is just a few months away from finally launching its electric SUV, and the company now says the upcoming vehicle — dubbed Gravity — will have Tesla’s North American Charging Standard (NACS) built right in, making an adapter unnecessary. Lucid announced the news ahead of a planned “Technology and Manufacturing Day” event at […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: MariaDB goes private with new CEO as K1 closes acquisition
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
MariaDB‘s short-lived tenure as a public company is all but over, as the struggling database business is now fully under the auspices of K1 Investment Management. MariaDB also announced a new CEO in former Micro Focus executive Rohit de Souza, who replaces Paul O’Brien after just 16 months in the hotseat in preparation for life […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: JFrog deepens its partnership with GitHub, launches runtime security service
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
In addition, JFrog is also launching a runtime security solution, as well as an integration with Nvidia's NIM microservices.

item.title: Qualifyze swallows $54M to improve pharmaceutical supply chains
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
In the world of pharmaceuticals, companies aim to operate under GMP guidelines — a set of production and manufacturing measures to assure standards for medicinal products. But too often, the reality is anything but that.  “Officially, GMP stands for ‘Good Manufacturing Practices,’” said Dr. David Schneider, the founder and CEO of Qualifyze. “But people joke […]

item.title: Inversion Space accelerates orbital reentry vehicle tech with $71M Space Force contract
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Goods are shipped around the world via roads, rail and air. Why not space, too? That’s the question posed by Inversion Space, a Los Angeles-based startup that’s developing a reentry capsule that it says will be capable of autonomously landing anywhere on Earth to a football field-sized degree of accuracy.  Equipped with a new $71 […]

item.title: StackGen raises $12.3M for its infrastructure-from-code service
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
In addition to the code, StackGen also visualizes what the new infrastructure will look like, and users can drag and drop additional resources in this interfaces as needed.

item.title: Hardware companies dominate a list of promising climate tech startups

item.description:
A new report from Congruent Ventures and SVB highlights startups that could significantly reduce carbon emissions, mitigating climate change.

item.title: Smartcat secures $43M for its AI-powered translation platform
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Smartcat, founded in 2016, is among the vendors providing automated translation tools geared toward enterprises, and its co-founder and CEO, Ivan Smolnikov, says business is good.

item.title: Form3, a quiet giant in UK fintech, raises $60M at a $570M valuation
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Form3, a startup building tools to connect financial players with each other to enable account payments, has it raised $60 million to continue expanding its business.

item.title: Threads is not working on its own DM system yet, but it might make it easier to send Instagram messages
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
The Threads team is not yet working on a separate inbox or a direct messaging system for the social network, despite user demands and will continue to use Instagram inbox. However, the company might make it easier to send messages to Instagram right from the Threads app. App researcher Adwaith Varma posted on Threads an unreleased Threads […]

item.title: Google loses appeal against EU’s $2.7B Shopping antitrust case, as bloc also wins $15B Apple state aid appeal
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Google has once again lost in its bid to overturn a 2017 antitrust decision by the European Commission. The bloc found its shopping comparison service had broken competition rules — hitting Alphabet, Google’s parent, with an at-the-time record-breaking €2.42 billion penalty (around $2.7 billion at current exchange rates) and ordering changes to how it operates […]
